resources.string: "%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
"Allow alerts to sound even when Mute or Do Not Disturb are on. These can't be silenced: Urgent Low, Transmitter Failure, and Sensor Failure."
Your alert settings were reset to factory defaults.
Click OK to personalize your alert settings.
Allows you to create a different alert settings for a different time period (e.g. sleeping at night).

"The available storage on your mobile device is almost full. To ensure your Dexcom CGM app functions correctly, please follow these steps to free up storage: 1. Exit this app 2. Go to Settings> General>Usage> Manage Storage 3. Free unnecessary storage
If your mobile device does not have any available storage, you will not receive any glucose information or alerts."
The available storage on your mobile device is almost full.

"There is not enough available storage for the Dexcom CGM app to function correctly. Please follow these steps to free up storage: 1. Exit this app 2. Go to Settings> General>Usage> Manage Storage 3. Free unnecessary storage
If you do not, you will not receive any glucose information or alerts."
"Transmitter found. Swipe and tap 'Pair' on pairing request."

"The Dexcom CGM app is no longer working correctly.
Delete the Dexcom CGM app from this mobile device. Then go to the Google Play store and download the Dexcom CGM app again.
When you open the Dexcom CGM app again, enter your Dexcom username and password."

"The Dexcom CGM app encountered a temporary error.
Exit and restart the application."

"Your transmitter battery is critically low.
Order a new transmitter immediately."

"Your session will end in less than 30 minutes.
You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your sensor."

"Your session will end in two hours.
You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your sensor."

"Your session will end in six hours.
You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your sensor."

"Sensor Failed. Replace sensor now.
You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your sensor."
"If you haven't already, please order a new transmitter."
Alerts will not sound due to phone settings

"Attention: Dexcom has not tested this app on this Android version and / or mobile device. The app will continue to function although there may be areas that may not work as expected. For more information, tap on the 'More information' link below."
This app is invalid, and all features are disabled at this time. Please contact Dexcom for more information.
App is unable to contact the Dexcom server. Access to the app is denied until this communication issue is resolved. Please check device setting and return to the app to try contacting again.
Warning! Please contact Dexcom for more information. Accepting this warning message will allow you to continue using the App, however there may be a known issue with some functionality.

"Are you sure?
This will reset all alert settings to factory default."
Review your alert schedule settings. Tap Done when complete.

"The \"Fall Rate Alert\" can alert you when your glucose levels are falling at or below the set level.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"The \"High Glucose Alert\" can alert you when your glucose levels rise above the set level.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"The \"Low Glucose Alert\" can alert you when your glucose levels fall below the set level.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"The \"Rise Rate Alert\" can alert you when your glucose levels are rising at or above the set level.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"The \"Signal Loss Alert\" can alert you when the app stops receiving glucose readings from your transmitter.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"The \"Urgent Low Glucose Alarm\" will alarm you when your glucose levels fall below %1$s %2$s.
Depending on your mobile device settings, the alert may be:
1. Silent 2. Sound 3. Vibration
"

"Please enter a valid carb value.
A valid carb value is between 0 and 250 grams."

"Please enter a valid time value.
A valid time value is between 0 minutes and 6 hours."

"Please enter a valid insulin value.
A valid insulin value is between 0.00 and 250.00 units."
You will need to take two fingersticks with your meter and enter the values into your app.
You need to enter two BG meter values only at the beginning of your sensor session.
"Enter your BG meter value into either the app or receiver. You don't need to enter the value into both."
"Steps: 1. Wash and dry your hands. 2. Take a fingerstick with your meter. 3. Tap the green circle above and"
promptly enter the exact value from your meter.
Make sure to insert your sensor and attach your transmitter in order to pair.

"You will NOT receive sensor glucose readings or alerts until your 2-hour warmup and two BG meter values are complete.
We will notify you when your sensor warmup is complete. "
Currently you are not connected to the Internet. Please try again later when you have Internet access.
We are experiencing a temporary issue with the Dexcom server. Please try again later.

"Please enter your password for your Dexcom account.
If you do not already have a Dexcom account, tap \"Sign up\" on the bottom of the previous screen."

"Please enter your username for your Dexcom account.
If you do not already have a Dexcom account, tap \"Sign up\" on the bottom of the previous screen."
The password you entered is incorrect. Please try again.
The maximum number of login attempts of 5 has been exceeded. Please try again in 10 minutes.
The username you entered is not linked to a Dexcom account.

"Please enter a valid BG meter value.
A valid meter value is between %1$s and %2$s %3$s."
It will take up to 30 minutes for your mobile device to connect to your transmitter using Bluetooth.
Now connecting your mobile device to your transmitter
and on the bottom of the transmitter box.
Select the height of the Y-axis on your trend graph.
Select if the trend graph will be displayed as an ongoing notification while in a sensor session.
To pair a new transmitter, you must first stop your current sensor session.
The transmitter SN is printed on the back of your transmitter

"You already have the maximum amount of followers.
You will have to delete one of your followers in order to add a new one."
To start sharing again, turn sharing on.
To temporarily stop sharing, turn sharing off.
To release the transmitter, snap the latch off of the housing by pressing down on the lip at the bottom of the latch.

To remove the sensor pod and transmitter from your body, peel the adhesive patch off your body like a Band-Aid®. When you peel off the adhesive patch, sensor, housing and transmitter will all be removed. Do NOT remove the transmitter while the adhesive patch is on your skin.
Remove the transmitter by pulling it straight out of the housing. Keep the transmitter to use again in your next sensor session.

"To remove the sensor pod from your body: Peel the adhesive off your body like a Band-Aid®. When you peel off the adhesive, the sensor, sensor pod and transmitter will all be removed. Do not remove the transmitter from the sensor pod until all components have been removed from your body."
"To remove the transmitter from the sensor pod: Use your fingers to spread the back tabs of the sensor pod. The transmitter will pop out. Keep the transmitter. See your User Guide."
The available storage on your mobile device is almost full. To ensure your Dexcom CGM app functions correctly, please follow these steps to free up storage:
If your mobile device does not have any available storage, you will not receive any glucose information or alerts.
There is not enough available storage for the Dexcom CGM app to function correctly. Please follow these steps to free up storage:
If you do not, you will not receive any glucose information or alerts.
If not used in awhile, your smart device goes to sleep and stops sharing.
Set the stop time for your alert schedule.
No PDF reader is installed on this device.
No Phone app is installed on this device.
The Dexcom CGM app is no longer working correctly.
The application needs to be reset to factory default.
Click [here] to reset the application to factory default.
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - Fall Daytime
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - High Daytime
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - Low Daytime
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - NoData Daytime
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - Rise Daytime
Alert Settings --- Alert settings changed - UrgentLow Daytime
Alerts Engine --- Fall Rate Alert notification
Alerts Engine --- High Glucose Alert notification
Alerts Engine --- Low Glucose Alert notification
Alerts Engine --- Time spent out of glucose control range
Alerts Engine --- Rise Rate Alert notification
Alerts Engine --- Urgent Low Glucose Alarm notification
Enter BG Screen --- Calibration vs Transmitter
Analytics Logger --- Glucose level changes after an alert
Event Logger --- Event logged by user
Event Logger --- Glucose level when entering carb data
Sensor Pairing Wizard - Step 16 - Manual Entry of Transmitter SN --- Pairing process timer
Sensor Pairing Wizard - Step 16 - Barcode Scanner --- Pairing process timer
Sensor Pairing Wizard - Step 17 --- Setup wizard duration
Resource Manager --- Time spent out of range / no data
Share Logic Engine --- Backfilling EGVs - Phone to Server
Share Screen --- Number Of Followers Event

"The Dexcom CGM app is unable to locate an email account set up on this mobile device.
Please Follow these steps to send an email to Dexcom:"
Go to Settings>Mail, Contacts, Calendars>Add account
Return to this app to send an email to Dexcom
please fill out this form in order for Dexcom to assist you.
I can be reached at this phone number
During your schedule, you will be alerted when your sensor glucose reading rises above:
Location permission is needed to connect to your transmitter. Press OK to reconnect Bluetooth.
Location permission is needed for communicating with the transmitter using Bluetooth
Please enter the new password for Dexcom account:
Someone changed your Dexcom account password.
Please enter the new password on the next screen.
If you think someone has accessed your account without your permission please call Dexcom Technical Support at
During your schedule, you will be alerted when your sensor glucose reading falls below:
Your transmitter battery is critically low.
Enter new BG meter value in 15 min
Enter new BG meter value after %s
Bluetooth on your mobile device is off. Bluetooth must be on in order to get glucose information on your mobile device.
• Using the exact number from your meter
"• Using only fingerstick blood glucose values "
• After you have taken acetaminophen (such as Tylenol®)
• If your value is higher than %1$s %2$s or lower than %3$s %4$s
"Make sure there are no obstructions, such as a wall, between your transmitter and mobile device. Move your device close to your transmitter. "
Wait up to 30 minutes while your transmitter restores communication with your mobile device.

"Someone changed the time on this mobile device. Please wait up to 10 minutes while the Dexcom CGM app adjusts to the new time.
This screen will go away as soon as the adjustment is finished."
Make sure your transmitter is properly inserted into your sensor pod.
If the error continues, go to Menu > Settings > Transmitter > Pair new to go through the pairing process again.
" Taking medications containing acetaminophen, such as Tylenol®. Glucose information is usually not available for up to three hours after taking acetaminophen"
" Make sure your transmitter is properly inserted into your sensor pod"
Wait three hours while the transmitter tries to fix the error. Do not enter another BG during this time.
Error still present after three hours
"Enter new BG meter value in 15 min"
"You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your transmitter. "
• After washing and drying your hands
Tap to enter your first BG meter value
Tap to enter your second BG meter value

"You will not receive sensor glucose readings or alerts until your 2-hour warmup and two BG meter values are complete.
We will notify you when warm up is complete and its time to enter your BG meter values."
Tap \"Pair\" on the request you will receive in up to 30 minutes.
Are you sure you want to stop your sensor?
You will not receive alerts or alarms after you stop your sensor, unless you replace your sensor.
Your alert settings were reset to factory defaults.
The Dexcom CGM app is no longer working correctly.
Allow location permission to receive alerts and glucose updates.
The storage on your mobile device is full.
The available storage on your mobile device is almost full.
Turn on Bluetooth to receive alerts and glucose updates.
Sensor session ends in under 2 hours.
Sensor session ends in under 30 minutes.
Sensor session ends in under 6 hours.
Transmitter has expired. Replace the transmitter.
Your transmitter will stop working in about two weeks.
Your transmitter will stop working in about three weeks.
Transmitter not compatible. Pair new transmitter.
Enter new BG meter value in 15 minutes.
Swipe to silence for up to 5 minutes.
Dexcom CGM requires the Location permission to continue.

"Dexcom CGM requires the Location permission to use Bluetooth.
To continue you must:
1. Tap “Go to app settings” 2. Tap “Permissions” 3. Enable “Location permission” 4. Open Dexcom CGM again to continue normal usage"
Camera Permission has been granted. Account photo can be taken.
Camera Permission has been granted. Barcode can be scanned.
Communication with your transmitter is now enabled.
Storage Permission has been granted. Account photo can be saved.
Camera Permission is needed to take an account photo.
Camera Permission is needed to scan for your barcode.

"Dexcom CGM requires the Location permission to use Bluetooth.
To continue you must:
1. Tap “Go to app settings” 2. Tap “Permissions” 3. Enable “Location permission” 4. Open Dexcom CGM again to continue setup"
Storage Permission is needed to take an account photo.
Allow scheduled alerts to sound when Mute or Do Not Disturb are on.
Set the days for your alert schedule.
Enter a name for your alert schedule.
Your session will end in two hours.
Your session will end in less than 30 minutes.
Your session will end in six hours.
You will not receive alerts or alarms after this time, unless you replace your sensor.

"To remove the sensor pod from your body: Peel the adhesive off your body like a Band-AidÂ®. When you peel off the adhesive, the sensor, sensor pod and transmitter will all be removed. Do not remove the transmitter from the sensor pod until all components have been removed from your body."
• Notifications from this app are disabled in your device settings
In order to receive CGM alerts, such as the Low glucose alert and the High glucose alert, you must allow Dexcom to send your mobile device notifications.
If you have taken acetaminophen (e.g. Tylenol®)
The Dexcom CGM app will check to see if Bluetooth is turned \"on\" after you tap \"next\".

"The Dexcom CGM app will check to see if Bluetooth is turned “on” after you tap “next”.
Tap “allow” when prompted to allow Dexcom CGM access to your device’s location."
Place barcode within these two green guides. The app will take the photo automatically.
Bluetooth allows devices to wirelessly communicate when positioned next to each other.
Your transmitter links to your mobile device by Bluetooth.
IMPORTANT: If Bluetooth is turned \"off\", you will not receive any glucose information or alerts.
You must also allow Dexcom CGM access to your device’s location as a requirement to use Bluetooth.

"and on the bottom of the transmitter box.
Please enter the valid transmitter SN."
Bluetooth on your mobile device needs to be \"on\" in order for the system to work.
You must also allow Dexcom CGM access to your device’s location.
You can receive Low and High glucose alerts on your mobile device.
The Dexcom CGM app will check to see if notifications are turned \"on\" after you tap \"I understand\".

I acknowledge and agree that my use of Dexcom®G5™Mobile is at all times subject to, and shall comply with the [Terms of Use] and that my personal information may be used by Dexcom and its affiliate, SweetSpot Diabetes Care Inc., in accordance with the [Privacy Policy].
Continue to use your meter until you understand:
How a sensor works in different situations such as meals, exercise, or first day

Do Not Disturb" For Android version 7.0 or higher:
You won't get any alarm or alert sounds if your smart device is on the "most restrictive" Do Not Disturb setting.
See your product instructions for suggested smart device settings."
Do not take acetaminophen (such as Tylenol®).
You will hear your Urgent Low Glucose Alarm unless you disable app notifications in your smart device settings.
Do not ignore symptoms of high and low glucose.
Do not bring any portion of a Dexcom G5 Mobile into a room with MRI, CT, or diathermy medical equipment.
Do not use the Dexcom CGM app for treatment decisions. The Dexcom CGM app does not replace a blood glucose meter.
Make treatment decisions with your Dexcom G5 Mobile when your symptoms match your CGM reading.

"In order to receive CGM alerts, you must allow Dexcom to send you notifications. These notifications include CGM information only. No promotional notifications will be sent.
For more information, see your User Guide."
"New to Dexcom G5 Mobile? Keep using your meter to make treatment decisions until you know how Dexcom G5 Mobile works for you. Don't rush! It may take days, weeks or months to gain confidence."

"A photo was taken of a barcode, but it was not the transmitter barcode.
The transmitter barcode is located on the bottom of the transmitter box."

"Notifications for this app are now turned \"off\". You will NOT receive CGM Alerts, such as the Low glucose alert.
To turn notifications \"on\":"
When you have a number AND arrow, you can use your CGM to make treatment decisions, like treating for a low or dosing for a high.
Please enter the valid transmitter SN.
For complete information, see your User Guide.
You will be alerted when your sensor glucose readings rise above:
Always Sound" Setting allows alerts to sound even when Mute or Do Not Disturb are on."
Please take a photo of the transmitter barcode or enter the transmitter SN manually.
Taking acetaminophen while wearing the sensor may falsely raise your sensor glucose readings.
Talk to your healthcare professional about using Dexcom G5 Mobile for treatment decisions.
Tap \"OK\" when you receive the following notification on the next screen.
Your transmitter sends glucose information to your mobile device.
The next few screens will walk you through how to connect your transmitter to your mobile device.

"Bluetooth on your mobile device is \"off\". Bluetooth must be on in order to get glucose information on your mobile device.
To turn Bluetooth \"on\":"
Turn Bluetooth \"on\". (You will not see any additions to the Devices list)

"In order to use the Dexcom CGM app, you must tap \"I agree\" to agree to the Dexcom CGM app Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
To read the full Terms of Use and Privacy Policy, tap on the green \"Terms of Use\" and \"Privacy Policy\"."
The transmitter SN is a combination of six numbers and letters, starting with the number 4.
The transmitter SN is printed on the bottom of your transmitter and on the bottom of the transmitter box.
The transmitter SN is printed on the bottom of your transmitter
You can make treatment decisions with your Dexcom G5 Mobile when:
You see a number AND arrow
You have not taken acetaminophen (e.g. Tylenol®)
"Trust your body. If your reading doesn't match how you feel, take a fingerstick before treating."

"This transmitter is already paired with another smart device.
A transmitter can be paired with only one smart device at a time."
Your transmitter and mobile device connect using Bluetooth®.
The transmitter SN begins with the number 4.
"The transmitter SN does not contain any of the following letters: I, O, V, Z."
Using your mobile device, take a photo of the barcode found on the bottom of the transmitter box.
The next few screens walk you through setting up your Low and High glucose alerts.
If you pair an Android Wear watch, these settings can prevent alarm/alerts (even severe lows):
The watch does not connect directly to the transmitter.
Welcome! Use your product instructions along with this app to help you get started.
When in doubt, get your meter out.
When your smart device is on Mute, Do Not Disturb or the volume is too low to hear, you will still hear:

"When your glucose is at or above your High alert setting, your device will alert you. You can adjust this setting.
For more information, see your User Guide."

"When your glucose is at or below your Low alert setting, your device will alert you. You can adjust this setting.
For more information, see your User Guide."
You will be alerted when your sensor glucose readings fall below:

"The Dexcom Share server is temporarily unavailable.
Your Followers won't be receiving your data and notifications while the server is unavailable.
We are diligently working on resolving the issue. Please check back for a status update."
"There can be many different reasons why your mobile device is not sharing. Make sure:"
1. Your Wi-Fi or cellular connection is \"on\"
2. You are in an area that has cellular reception
3. You can access the web via a browser, confirming you currently have internet access
4. If using a mobile device, your cell phone plan allows internet access while on a phone call
7. Sharing is \"enabled\" on the previous screen
8. You have active Followers (who accepted your Share invitation) listed in the Followers list on the previous screen
Welcome! Dexcom Share allows you, the Sharer, to send your information to another person, the Follower.
To make sure you are sharing, you must see BOTH a colored logo and a glucose value.
If you are not sharing, the logo will turn gray with a red badge.
There will be times when your Follower cannot see your glucose information.
An example: Follower is in a remote area with no Internet access. Your Dexcom CGM app should always be the primary source of glucose information.
You currently are not sharing your glucose information with anyone since you have not added any Followers.
For complete information see your User Guide.
Invitation will be sent to this address
Please enter the name of the Follower you would like to add.
Please enter a valid email for the Follower you would like to add.
Please make sure the two email addresses are identical.
There is already a Follower named %1$s in your list of Followers.
When switched off, %1$s will only be able to see your current glucose value and not your trend graph.
"Set notification settings for %1$s. %1$s will be able to modify these settings later."
Your Follower will be notified once your sensor glucose readings drop below the Urgent Low notification level.

"Your Follower will be notified when they stop receiving glucose readings from you. Your Follower will not receive: 1. Glucose readings 2. Notifications 3. Trend Graph updates
"
Your Follower will be notified when your sensor glucose readings drop below the Low notification level for the set amount of time.
Your Follower will be notified when your sensor glucose readings rise above the High notification level for the set amount of time.
Here is the summary of settings that will be sent to %1$s.
When switched off, %1$s will not see your trend graph.
To share your glucose information, you must have Internet (Wi-Fi or a cell phone data plan).
Please enter the name of your Follower.
IMPORTANT: If Internet access is turned OFF or unavailable, your Follower will not receive your glucose information.
S Health Connection Failure. Check your S Health Settings.
Dexcom CGM currently does not have permission to share information with S Health
S Health is a fitness app that can track your health data. Using S Health is optional.
S Health permissions were not acquired.
Dexcom CGM posts information to S Health with a three hour delay.
"To change S Health settings, go to the S Health app or tap 'Edit Permissions' below."
To enable S Health, tap “Get S Health” below.
The \"Signal Loss Alert\" can notify you when a signal loss has occurred in the sensor or Bluetooth connection.
Set the start time for your alert schedule.
Can you guess who is discreetly managing their diabetes with the Dexcom Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) app?
David uses the Dexcom CGM app to view glucose information and notifications on his mobile device.
"David's transmitter sends glucose information directly to David's mobile device."
David remotely shares his glucose information with his wife. She can also receive glucose notifications.
The transmitter you are trying to pair is not compatible with this app.
Please visit our website at [www.dexcom.com] for further information on the Android-compatible transmitter.
Your current transmitter will stop working in about one week.
This is the last sensor session with your current transmitter.
Your transmitter battery is low. The transmitter will stop working in about two weeks.
Your transmitter battery is low. The transmitter will stop working in about three weeks.
If you do not already have a new transmitter, please order one now.
"To remove the transmitter from the sensor pod: Use your fingers to spread the back tabs of the sensor pod. The transmitter will pop out. Keep the transmitter. See your User Guide."
The \"Urgent Low Glucose Alarm\" notification level and repeat setting cannot be changed or turned off. Only the sound setting can be changed.

Alert Schedule" Allows you to schedule and customize a second group of alerts.
For example, set different alert settings at night."
Always Sound" Setting allows alerts to sound even when Mute or Do Not Disturb are on."
Sound Icons" Shows current app sound status."
"No alarm or alert sounds due to Do Not Disturb settings"
